intro: Ceropegia brachyceras, commonly known as the dwarf arrowroot or small-headed ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, and it produces small, fleshy tubers underground. This species is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in various growing conditions.
